comments.raw_text: There are a few issues in the BinAST frontend not being patched as changes to the normal parser were made. These patches fix some of them.
comments.text: There are a few issues in the BinAST frontend not being patched as changes to the normal parser were made. These patches fix some of them.
comments.creator: tcampbell@mozilla.com
comments.author: tcampbell@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
Lazy scripts generated by BinAST parser do not track their inner-functions or
their closed-over-binding info so remove misleading code. In the
finishLazyFunction code the `pc_` is actually for parent and it is invalid
for us to use it here.
comments.text:
Created attachment 9142472
Bug 1632229 - Use BaseScript::CreateRawLazy in the BinAST case. r?mgaudet


Lazy scripts generated by BinAST parser do not track their inner-functions or
their closed-over-binding info so remove misleading code. In the
finishLazyFunction code the `pc_` is actually for parent and it is invalid
for us to use it here.
comments.creator: tcampbell@mozilla.com
comments.author: tcampbell@mozilla.com

comments.creator: tcampbell@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
This fixes some issues that snuck in for flag initialization in the BinAST
frontend. These changes match LazyScriptCreationData::create behaviour now.

Also remove a redundant strict flag initialization from BCEScriptStencil that
was missed in Bug 1628111.

Depends on D72008
comments.author: tcampbell@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 9142473
Bug 1632229 - Fixup BinAST lazy script flag computation. r?mgaudet


This fixes some issues that snuck in for flag initialization in the BinAST
frontend. These changes match LazyScriptCreationData::create behaviour now.

Also remove a redundant strict flag initialization from BCEScriptStencil that
was missed in Bug 1628111.

Depends on D72008
